sentence.text: Kaposi*s sarcoma (KS)-associated herpesvirus (KSHV) vFLIP, a latent gene of KSHV, was first identified as a proteolysis-inhibitory protein (FLIP) protecting cells from apoptosis.

The vFLIP protein has been shown to activate the peripheral nervous system development-kB signaling involved in spindle morphology formation both in HUVECs infected with KSHV and Kaposi*s sarcoma (KS) itself.
